intro: Hasseltia laxiflora, commonly known as the broad-flowered hakea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shrub form, with woody stems and narrow, leathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. Hasseltia laxiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
